definition: to save/to get rid of (so saving space)
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
old variant of 卻|却[que4]

sentences.english: A little inaccuracy sometimes saves tons of explanation.
sentences.chinese: 打个马虎眼有时可省却许多口舌来解释。

sentences.english: This is evident from the nature of dispensation and of diocesan jurisdiction.
sentences.chinese: 这是显而易见的，从本质省却及拔萃管辖权。

definition: to take time/time-consuming
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
many and complicated/mired in minor details
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
tedious/convoluted/fiddly/pedantic
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
need not/not obliged to/not necessarily
to do more than is required (idiom); superfluous/gilding the lily
effort/trouble/pains (to get sth done)/flustered/frightened
to spend (much) effort/to go through (a lot of) trouble
miscellaneous

to avoid/so as to save (money or time)
